Only have about 4 hours on this game, and I can honestly say it is my favorite game. The unique combination of comedy, reality, and intelligence is unlike any other game. I am constantly laughing at every line throughout the whole story. The reality is also great, this could show how the world may turn out in who knows how many years. Very creative game, and most definitely a must have. I am so happy it is on sale for $4.99...By far the best $5 I've ever spent!

i like it. it good. game good.

What can i say about this game?? It's just amazing! It's so unique has the first one of the series was. I liked Portal but this one is just way more, everything! The co-op was hell of fun! I just regret not have played it before! It has really funny momments, a really good interacting system, a nice gameplay. And some puzzles are actually hard! Me and my friend has some pain in the a** solving some of the later puzzles in the co-op history. But it was just a great experience, we had a lot of fun and i recommend 100% this game to everyone! And to get a friend to play it with you! This game really disearves the 95 ms that it has. It's a masterpiece!
fun

Absolutely a must have. Especially if you have a friend to play with. You and your partner in science will enjoy the hours of fun solving the Portal 2 co-op puzzles. They can be quarky, confusing, awesome, and when you'll love getting that "... OHHHHHHHhhhh oh oh oh I know what we gotta do" moments. After you are done with the co-op maps there are COUNTLESS of AMAZING A++ maps (some better than the stock co-op ones) that take the game's physics and creativity to the limit.

This game may be good for consoles, but it shines for the PC, the community makes such maps that will blow your mind. If you get brave and inspired, the creators have released a really nice and quick to pick up map maker that allows you to make that puzzle you've always wanted to share with your friends.
spent sooo much time on this game
Great game. Would reconmend it to anyone.

good ol' portal. just number two C:

Would i reccomend this game?: Hell yes!

Portal 2 - long forgotten skeletons in the Aperture closet


1.) An amazing sequel: builds upon the first one, and improves in every way. Aperture never looked more real or ridiculous - it got funnier and scarier at the same time (Cube meets Cabin in the Woods meets Douglas Adams).

2.) Hilarious small talk during most of the game by Wheatley, GLaDOS and Cave Johnson, the founder of Aperture himself.

3.) Gel gimmick, light-bridges, levitation rays = great additions to portal puzzles, bringing new, insanely fun challenges to the table. Still no cake though

4.) Extras - Comic book prequel, separate co-op campaign (with split screen!), free mods & puzzles made by the community, the level design tool itself.



"Well done. Here come the test results: "You are a horrible person." That's what it says: a horrible person. We weren't even testing for that."

Ein klasse Spiel für Rätselfreudige und Storyliebhaber. Der Singleplayermodus ist durchaus gelungen und es macht viel Spass diesen zu zocken. Für alle die den SP durchgezockt haben, können sich im coop mit anderen Spielern vergnügen.

Klare Kaufempfehlung!

Portal 2 is probably my favourite game of all time. Everything from the immersive atmosphere, to the characters, to the puzzles and level design are so superbly handled, that I couldn't even stop playing when I first tried it. The main mission took me about a weekend to finish, which for me, at a time when I don't have as much time to play games as I'd like, made it the perfect length. Add on to that the two-person co-op and all the puzzles you can pick up from fellow players, and you have a fantastic package. I highly recommend this game.
Very fun and addictive game. The Co-op makes it soo much easier to replay over and over.
